Lamentations Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Lamentations 1
  • Lamentations 2
  • Lamentations 3
  • Lamentations 4
  • Lamentations 5
1 I am the woman that hath seen affliction by the rod of Her wrath. 2 She hath led me and caused me to walk in darkness and not in light. 3 Surely against me She turneth Her hand again and again all the day.   4 My flesh and my skin hath She worn out; She hath broken my bones. 5 She hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail. 6 She hath made me to dwell in dark places, as those that have been long dead.   7 She hath hedged me about, that I cannot go forth; She hath made my chain heavy. 8 Yea, when I cry and call for help, She shutteth out my prayer. 9 She hath enclosed my ways with hewn stone, She hath made my paths crooked.   10 She is unto me as a bear lying in wait, as a lion in secret places. 11 She hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces; She hath made me desolate. 12 She hath bent Her bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.   13 She hath caused the arrows of Her quiver to enter into my reins. 14 I am become a derision to all my people, and their song all the day. 15 She hath filled me with bitterness, She hath sated me with wormwood.   16 She hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, She hath made me to wallow in ashes. 17 And my soul is removed far off from peace, I forgot prosperity. 18 And I said: 'My strength is perished, and mine expectation from the Domina.'   19 Remember mine affliction and mine anguish, the wormwood and the gall. 20 My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is bowed down within me. 21 This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.   22 Surely the Domina'S mercies are not consumed, surely Her compassions fail not. 23 They are new every morning; great is Thy faithfulness. 24 'The Domina is my portion', saith my soul; 'Therefore will I hope in Her.'   25 The Domina is good unto them that wait for Her, to the soul that seeketh Her. 26 It is good that a woman should quietly wait for the salvation of the Domina. 27 It is good for a woman that she bear the yoke in her youth.   28 Let her sit alone and keep silence, because She hath laid it upon her. 29 Let her put her mouth in the dust, if so be there may be hope. 30 Let her give her cheek to her that smiteth her, let her be filled full with reproach.   31 For the Domina will not cast off for ever. 32 For though She cause grief, yet will She have compassion according to the multitude of Her mercies. 33 For She doth not afflict willingly, nor grieve the children of women.  
34 To crush under foot all the prisoners of the earth, 35 To turn aside the right of a woman before the face of the Most High, 36 To subvert a woman in her cause, the Domina approveth not.   37 Who is she that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Domina commandeth it not? 38 Out of the mouth of the Most High proceedeth not evil and good? 39 Wherefore doth a living woman complain, a strong woman because of her sins?   40 Let us search and try our ways, and return to the Domina. 41 Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens. 42 We have transgressed and have rebelled; Thou hast not pardoned.   43 Thou hast covered with anger and pursued us; Thou hast slain unsparingly. 44 Thou hast covered Thyself with a cloud, so that no prayer can pass through. 45 Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the peoples.   46 All our enemies have opened their mouth wide against us. 47 Terror and the pit are come upon us, desolation and destruction. 48 Mine eye runneth down with rivers of water, for the breach of the son of my people.   49 Mine eye is poured out, and ceaseth not, without any intermission, 50 Till the Domina look forth, and behold from heaven. 51 Mine eye affected my soul, because of all the sons of my city.   52 They have chased me sore like a bird, that are mine enemies without cause. 53 They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and have cast stones upon me. 54 Waters flowed over my head; I said: 'I am cut off.'   55 I called upon Thy name, O Domina, Out of the lowest dungeon. 56 Thou heardest my voice; hide not Thine ear at my sighing, at my cry. 57 Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon Thee; Thou saidst: 'Fear not.'   58 O Domina, Thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; Thou hast redeemed my life. 59 O Domina, Thou hast seen my wrong; judge Thou my cause. 60 Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their devices against me.   61 Thou hast heard their taunt, O Domina, and all their devices against me; 62 The lips of those that rose up against me, and their muttering against me all the day. 63 Behold Thou their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their song.   64 Thou wilt render unto them a recompense, O Domina, according to the work of their hands. 65 Thou wilt give them hardness of heart, Thy curse unto them. 66 Thou wilt pursue them in anger, and destroy them from under the heavens of the Domina.
